Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with part of lotus flower in added red and white; exterior: painted decoration consisting of head of goose, to right; at far left, part of undetermined motif; below goose, possibly part of undetermined filling ornament.
Producer name: Attributed to: Group of the Würzburg Chalices
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in the Würzburg Chalice Group. The sherds from this group display stylistic similarities with the two Würzburg chalices (Lemos 1991, pl. 20-1, no. 236-7). Geese are very rarely depicted on later Mature Animal Style vases, however, the presence of interior decoration suggests that the chalice is late in the Wild Goat Style and may represent a transition to the later Mature Animal Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 71, p. 236, no. 152, pl. 14) (Incorrectly labelled 1888.6-1.475c)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0381) (phase 2)
